dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 2886 IH: Defend our Coast Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Ms. Ross (for herself, Mr. Connolly, Ms. McClellan, Mrs. Foushee, Ms. Elfreth, Mr. Scott of Virginia, and Mr. Beyer) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Natural Resources

form.official-title: To amend the Outer Continental Shelf Lands Act to withdraw the outer Continental Shelf in the Mid-Atlantic Planning Area from disposition, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Defend our Coast Act.

section.header: Withdrawal from disposition of Mid-Atlantic outer Continental Shelf
section.text: Section 12 of the Outer Continental Shelf Lands Act (43 U.S.C. 1341) is amended by adding at the end the following:

subsection.header: Withdrawal from disposition of Mid-Atlantic outer Continental Shelf
subsection.text: The Secretary may not issue a lease for the exploration, development, or production of oil or gas on the outer Continental Shelf in the Mid-Atlantic Planning Area, as such planning area is depicted in the 2024â€“2029 National Outer Continental Shelf Oil and Gas Leasing Proposed Final Program (September 2023).
